alert.note: Alert for Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 7:59PM EDT until September 04 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Leslie. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 759 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to intense showers and embedded thunderstorms. Excessive runoff will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hyden, Stinnett, Hosea, Hoskinston, Wendover, Essie and Asher.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
